alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Cullman; DeKalb; Franklin; Jackson; Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone; Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 04 at 3:55AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Areal Flooding and River Flooding is Possible This Week... A frontal boundary that moved across the area on Saturday, will return northward as a warm front Monday, then become stationary in a west to east orientation over or near the Tennessee Valley this week. A series of systems moving along this boundary will bring numerous to widespread showers, along with a few thunderstorms to the area for much of the work week. Rounds of moderate to heavy rainfall are expected to impact the Tennessee Valley. Runoff from excessive rainfall could result Areal Flooding, as well as flooding of area streams and rivers. Flash Flooding will also be possible during this time. Rainfall totals at this time should range from 1-2 inches south of the Tennessee River, to 2-4 inches near the Alabama and Tennessee border. Where the heaviest rainfall occurs will depend upon where the frontal boundary is located. A Flood Watch may be required for portions of northern Alabama and southern middle Tennessee. Residents in the Tennessee Valley should stay current with the latest forecast updates from the National Weather Service. For additional hydrologic information, visit our website at: weather.gov/huntsville
